problem.p: A bowling ball of mass \(m\) and radius \(R\) is initially thrown down an alley with an initial speed \(v_0\), and it slides without rolling but due to friction it begins to roll.

During the time when the ball starts to roll because of friction, and before it starts rolling without slipping, angular momentum is conserved around:
The center of mass of the bowling ball. A fixed point along the horizontal line going through the center of mass. A fixed point on the floor. Any fixed point, including any of the points above.
